title: Project Coordinator, Engagement Hub (Garland) -garland
description: Job DescriptionAetna's Medicaid Care Management Engagement Outreach Hub is a new initiative focused on prioritizing Medicaid member interaction, maximizing inbound and outbound touchpoints to solve members' needs and create behavioral change. How we do this is through a dedicated and caring team of health care professionals who connect with passion, caring and behavioral interviewing techniques. This team has a drive to exceed the delivery of Medicaid Health care services. Focus is on the Hub's efficiency and productivity efforts whereby the Care Management Associates interact and engage telephonically with members. Through the successful supports orchestrated by the Hub team, this comprehensive care coordination is a collaborative demonstration of innovative healthcare navigation and motivational health plan customer support representation. This is an exciting time to join Aetna, a CVS Health Company, in our journey to change the way healthcare is delivered today. We are health care innovators.The Engagement Outreach Hub Project Coordinator supports the development, implementation and ongoing management of project(s) associated to the healthcare services related to member outreach and engagement. The Project Coordinator has responsibility for leading/managing all aspects of a project and or program such as planning, coordination, development, and implementation including any implications to the Hub team while prioritizing work, resources and time. Ensures the end state of the project meets business objective(s) and that all deliverables and due dates are met. Highly collaborative process often requires managing relationships across the segments or multiple functional areas. The Project Coordinator is accountable to leadership to support the day to day operations of the team. This position has no supervisory oversight of staff, but requires a solid understanding of the workflows, policies and procedures to ensure the team is producing at a successful level.Adheres to Compliance with policies and procedure/regulatory standards. Maintains accurate and complete documentation of required information that meets risk management, regulatory, and accreditation requirements. Protects the confidentiality of member information and adheres to company policies regarding confidentialityRequired Qualifications* Serve as a mentor and resource to team members and support to Supervisor for coordination of projects, highly collaborative and astute to business needs and project oversight.* Demonstrates effective communication, telephonic and organization skills with ability to be agile, managing multiple priorities at one time, and adapting to change with enthusiasm. Ability to meet project deadlines and ability to meet metrics and assist in productivity metric oversight with accuracy.* Support a positive work environment that promotes the concept of teamwork.* Strong customer service skills to coordinate service delivery including attention to customers, sensitivity to issues, proactive identification and resolution of issues to promote positive outcomes for members, adhering to care management processes (to include, but not limited to, privacy and confidentiality, quality management processes in compliance with regulatory, accreditation guidelines, company policies and procedures).* Works independently and competently, meting deliverables and deadlines while demonstrating an outgoing, enthusiastic and caring presence telephonically. The Project Coordinator may assist with team duties, workflow and project workflow during times of staff absence or as directed by leadership.* Ability to effectively participate in a multi-disciplinary team including internal and external participants.Preferred Qualifications* 2 years related work experience.* Proven track record meeting project dates.* Proficiency with computers including knowledge of Microsoft Word, Outlook, and Excel - data entry and documentation within member records.* Familiarity with basic medical terminology and concepts used in care management preferred.* Strong organizational skills, including effective verbal and written communication skills.* Flexibility to work occasional nights and weekends outside of standard business hours which can span from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.EducationBachelor's degree or equivalent experienceBusiness OverviewAt Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

title: Chief Information Officer
description: At Revere Health, we value the health of our patients above all else. As the largest independent multi-specialty physician group in Utah, our healthcare system gives patients the best in communication, quality, coordination and innovation. Founded in 1960 in Provo, Utah, Revere Health has grown to include 29 medical specialties in over 100 locations throughout Utah, Arizona and Nevada.As one of two Accountable Care Organizations accredited by Medicare in Utah, Revere Health offers a unique, patient-oriented approach to healthcare. We strive to keep medical costs at a minimum while providing the utmost in quality healthcare.Revere Health: Your Health Above All ElsePosition SummaryThe Chief Information Officer is responsible for all of the Clinic's technological needs. This includes strategic visioning, planning, development, maintenance, and support of core IT infrastructure. Management and maintenance of enterprise and department specific applications, and clinic-wide applications and programs. This position will evaluate overall information technology operations; oversee the design and implementation of new applications and changes to existing computer systems and software; evaluate and procure new hardware and software to meet strategic needs. This position will be responsible for managing the day to day activities of the Technology Teams, such as IT and HIM, and instituting controls to ensure smooth and effective service to the Clinic's internal and external customers. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining the Department's information system security to include compliance with all regulatory rules and standards (HIPAA, others), cybersecurity, system back-up to include processes for redundancy, testing and addition of new technologies and services. The CIO will provide vision and leadership by championing key technology initiatives that will transform the way the Revere Health does business internally, with its partners, clients, and other stakeholders.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesUnderstand Clinic business strategy, translate that strategy into a technology plan and drive execution against the plan.Develop annual technology budget and monitor expenditures.Assume full management responsibility for the Technology Department including planning, development, personnel, and operational activities. Identify and mentor technology professionals in order to build and maintain a high performance team.Hold end to end accountability for making Technology Services meet organizational needs including applications, infrastructure, and innovations.Design, implement and orchestrate an innovative and disciplined software development process.Manage the Technology Committee and review and recommend vendor proposals and contracts to enhance services and performance.Make decisions on funding priorities, requests for staffing, major technology issues, and new operational initiatives in consultation with the CEO.Monitor and evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery methods and procedures and allocate resources accordingly. Provide performance reviews, optimization, and standardization of best practices.Develop and oversee documentation of systems knowledge and methods to enable stability and continuous improvement, performance gains, and consistency.Recommend, maintain, make available, and enforce approved policies, standards, practices, and security measures related to the infrastructure to ensure effective and consistent information processing operations and to safeguard information resources.Position the Department’s technology assets for the future to be an industry leader.Develop and build strong relationships with key partners to assist in implementing Technology projects.Stay abreast of new trends, requirements, and innovations in the field of information technology. Ensure all applicable regulatory rules and laws related to information technology, this includes software licensure, firewall, encryption requirements, and adequate passwords are maintained.Attends required meetings and participates on committees as requested.Other duties as assigned.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree with major coursework in an information technology field or equivalent experience. Masters preferred.Five years or more years of senior or executive level management experience within a medium to large organization that has a complex information technology operation. Strong strategic planning and leadership skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skillsKnowledge of project planning management and implementationAbility to coordinate multiple projects and complex tasks while meeting deadlinesSkilled strategic and visionary thinkerPrior healthcare experience is required.

title: Recruiter
description: Job Purpose: The Recruitment/ HR Generalist will be responsible for identifying, screening and interviewing part-time employees and volunteers for NWSRA programs. The individual will be an expert in creative sourcing strategies and have the ability to work in a high volume environment balancing multiple openings. HR Generalist functions will include administering various human resource activities for PT employees and volunteers including, but not limited to staffing, compensation, personnel records, and administrative correspondence. Assists with company training programs, including conducting new employee orientations. Provide limited advice, assistance and follow-up on company policies, procedures and documentation. Keep HR management informed of issues.Summary of Duties: NWSRA is looking for a self-sufficient experienced recruiter/HR Generalist, who has a can do attitude to recruit part-time employees and potential volunteers for recreational programming serving people with disabilities. Hiring is constant and we use a full cycle hiring process. Building relationships and using social media to create leads and build job pools for consistent applications, is essential. This position will also utilize their knowledge of benefits, policies and procedures, and federal and state laws pertaining to the human resource function, good analytical skills, and employee relations. Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion.Additional duties will include job fairs, outreach events, conducting new hire orientations and assist in the initial introduction of new hires to NWSRA.Specific skills needed are Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), knowledge of sourcing and hiring candidates using various media and platforms, applicant tracking systems and Human Resource Information Systems.Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Marketing or a related field required. Two (2) three (3) years of interviewing experience and high volume recruiting required. Two (2) three (3) years of HR Generalist experience. One (1) year of applicant tracking (ATS) experience preferred. Great interpersonal, organizational and time management skills. Knowledge of interviewing techniques and employment laws. Proven track record of sourcing and hiring applicants.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Under the direction of Artistic Director Michael Tilson Thomas, its unique fellowship program trains music school graduates for leadership roles in the field of classical music. Artistic excellence, connection to audiences, engaging communities and entrepreneurial activities are pillars of the experiential curriculum. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are high priorities for the NWS and are critical in the preparation of Fellows for leadership positions. The NWS pursues its work in a Frank Gehry-designed campus that is uniquely suited to embrace the digital future, for education and artistic expression.Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARYThe Director rents spaces within the New World Center to earn income that supports the New World Symphony Fellowship program. In addition, they partner with the Vice President to cultivate and support relationships with other nonprofits as a part of NWS's community participation, and steward relationships with trustees, corporate partners, alumni, and supporters who refer clients and rent the venue themselves for professional and personal functions. The Director will take lead on contracts and see those events through to completion. As needed, they will provide support to the Vice President for high profile events and those with large production scopes. They will work with the VP to build and manage relationships with event planners, destination management companies (DMCs), and the Greater Miami Convention and Visitors Bureau. title: Human Resources Analyst - HRIS (CD)
description: DescriptionThe Hanover County Human Resources Department has an exciting opportunity to join our Team! The incumbent performs complex tasks in the setup of new and management of current Human Resource Information Systems, administers Human Resources programs, and provides analysis in such areas as recruitment, classification/compensation, benefits or other personnel tracts as needed. Organization : The Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) Analyst reports to the Human Resources Information Systems Manager and supervises no staff. The HRIS Analyst may serve as lead worker on special projects. The HR Analyst is part of Hanover County's Career Development Program (CD).Essential Functions Manages the semi-monthly time card reconciliations in collaboration with team members and department payroll preparers. Provides oversight and support for the development, implementation and administration of Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) and associated systems; creates and maintains detailed HR system documentation. Consults with HR staff and departments to assess and define HRIS needs for various business functions, and on the design and utilization of HR information systems. Partners with vendors and IT to ensure system codes and configurations are created accurately and completely. Performs detailed testing of system capabilities for accuracy, integrity, and functionality. Designs and/or generates reports to support HR data needs. Monitors, analyzes and documents test results; identifies and resolves discrepancies. Researches, identifies and recommends areas of improvement, alternative processes, and system enhancements to support HR activities. Conducts routine audits to ensure data integrity. Designs and facilitates training related to HR information systems for business users. Manages the HR department website. Assists with the classification of positions. Gathers, analyzes and interprets salary data and trends. Leads the development of the HR annual year-end report. Interprets HR policies to employees and the public. Completes salary and benefit surveys and provides classification and compensation information as requested to employees, supervisors, other jurisdictions and the general public. Develops and administers department guidelines or procedures. Performs related work as assigned.Working Conditions Hazards None Known Environment Office Physical Effort Minimal ExemptKnowledge, Skills And AbilitiesKnowledge of the principles and practices of Human Resources administration, pertinent federal and state laws and regulations, required. Knowledge of Human Resource functions, HR information systems, and report writing required. Must have strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills. Must be able to present ideas and recommendations clearly and concisely both orally and in writing. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with County staff, vendors and the public is essential. Ability to keep statistical records and to make regular and special reports. Computer literacy/knowledge of spreadsheets, required. Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs, required. Must know how to organize and prioritize work and meet deadlines; strong aptitude for accuracy and attention to detail. Education, Experience and Training : Bachelor's degree (preferably in human resources, business administration, information technology, or public administration) required with at least two (2) years' related work experience preferred - OR - Any equivalent combination of education, experience and/or training sufficient to demonstrate the knowledge, skills and abilities is acceptable.Special Conditions Criminal Records check, including fingerprinting Work beyond normal work schedule Twelve-month probationary periodSpecial Instructions to ApplicantsIf you are selected for this position, you will be required to provide a copy of your diploma/degree.Closing Date/Time: Continuous

title: ASSISTANT PROFESSOR
description: Position SummaryThe undergraduate and graduate programs offered by the University of Wisconsin-Madison's Art Department are among the preeminent programs in the United States. The Department is known nationwide for its rigor, dedicated faculty, and accomplished students and alumni. The Book Art position will involve teaching multi-level classes in book arts, letterpress, papermaking and printmaking. Candidates must have an excellent working knowledge of hand book binding, letterpress, hand papermaking and relevant contemporary critical issues.The successful candidate should be a practicing artist who will contribute to the intellectual and academic life of the department through Research, Teaching and Service within a vibrant art department of 29 faculty members. The position offers the opportunity to work with the Kohler Art Library artist's book collection. The teaching load is three classes per semester and service on MFA committees. The desire and ability to interface with all areas of the Art Department is a significant facet of the position. The successful candidate must meet the teaching, research, and service expectations of the department and university.Principal DutiesPrincipal duties include a demonstrated proficiency in multiple area of expertise such as digital print technologies (for example laser cutter, 3D printed type, CNC router, polymer plate making, digital drawing), hand book binding, letterpress, hand papermaking and printmaking. Consideration will be given to candidates who have a background in digital print practices, and the ability to teach across Printmaking disciplines. The successful candidate will:Build and maintain a studio practice at a nationally recognized level.Provide leadership, mentoring, and guidance to students.Teach undergraduate and graduate students (Non-Majors, Certificate, Majors: BA, BFA, MA, and MFA).Serve on graduate committees with MA and MFA candidates.Work collegially in a three-person Printmaking area within a large vibrant Art Department.Participate in service activities at the local, state, and national level as well as the University.Maintain an active studio practice of nationally recognized quality, at a level that will meet tenure expectations at a research institution.Teach undergraduate and graduate level courses in a wide range/variety of Book Art, Papermaking & Printmaking art practices as well as working with graduate students from across the Department and serving on MA and MFA graduate committees.Have the opportunity to teach special topics classes to graduate and undergraduate students.Engage in service activities at the university, local, state, and national level.Meet the teaching, research, and service expectations of the department and university.Demonstrate an active commitment to the continued growth and development of the undergraduate and graduate program and community.Advise and mentor graduate students within an interdisciplinary Art Department.Have a strong commitment to using a combination of historic and new technologies within the practice of Book Arts, Papermaking & Printmaking.Oversee the Book Art and Papermill studio laboratories and serve and part of a highly ranked printmaking area within the art department.Facilitate new course offerings in artist books, letterpress and papermaking that combine multiple technologies and work across printmaking disciplines.Institutional Statement On DiversityDiversity is a source of strength, creativity, and innovation for UW-Madison. We value the contributions of each person and respect the profound ways their identity, culture, background, experience, status, abilities, and opinion enrich the university community. We commit ourselves to the pursuit of excellence in teaching, research, outreach, and diversity as inextricably linked goals.The University of Wisconsin-Madison fulfills its public mission by creating a welcoming and inclusive community for people from every background - people who as students, faculty, and staff serve Wisconsin and the world.For more information on diversity and inclusion on campus, please visit: Diversity and InclusionDegree And Area Of SpecializationBook Art, Papermaking & Printmaking. Candidate must hold an MFA degree in Art with a specialization in Book Arts, or Papermaking or equivalent relevant experience in the field.Minimum Years And Type Of Relevant Work ExperienceThe University of Wisconsin-Madison seeks candidates with distinguished exhibition and professional achievements. The ability to engage with a multi-disciplinary Art Department is a significant aspect of the position. Applicants should demonstrate evidence of excellence in teaching, a comprehensive understanding of historical and contemporary art theory and practice excellence in research and productivity in the field. A minimum of two years' college level teaching is preferred but not required.Department(s)A171000-SCHOOL OF EDUCATION/ARTWork TypeFull Time: 100%Appointment Type, DurationOngoing/RenewableAnticipated Begin DateAUGUST 22, 2022SalaryMinimum $78,000 ACADEMIC (9 months)Depending On QualificationsInstructions to Applicants:Please Upload The Following Letter of application stating how experience and credentials make you a good fit for this position. Teaching philosophy Proposals or Syllabi for introductory and advanced level courses Curriculum Vitae Names/email addresses/telephone numbers of 3 references (no recommendation letters). Documentation of artwork: submit up to 20 images.The deadline for assuring full consideration is September 10, 2021, however, positions will remain open and applications may be considered until the positions are filled.ContactTimothy Mccartytimothy.mccarty@wisc.edu608-262-1959Relay Access (WTRS): 7-1-1 (out-of-state: TTY: 800.947.3529, STS: 800.833.7637) and above Phone number (See RELAY_SERVICE for further information. )Official TitleASSISTANT PROFESSOR(C40NN)Employment ClassFacultyJob Number235632-FAThe University of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We promote excellence through diversity and encourage all qualified individuals to apply.If you need to request an accommodation because of a disability, you can find information about how to make a request at the following website: https://employeedisabilities.wisc.edu/disability-accommodation-information-for-applicants/The University of Wisconsin-Madison is engaged in a Title and Total Compensation (TTC) Project to redesign job titles and compensation structures. As a result of the TTC project, official job titles on current job postings may change. Job duties and responsibilities will remain the same. For more information please visit: https://hr.wisc.edu/title-and-total-compensation-study/ .Employment will require a criminal background check. Stat. sec. 19.36(7).The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains current campus safety and disciplinary policies, crime statistics for the previous 3 calendar years, and on-campus student housing fire safety policies and fire statistics for the previous 3 calendar years. title: Contracts Analyst
description: Company OverviewApache Corporation, founded in 1954, is one of the world's premier independent oil and gas exploration and production companies. With operations in the United States, Egypt and the United Kingdom (North Sea), the company has a presence in domestic and international basins. Apache is proud of its portfolio that includes exploration in conventional, unconventional, onshore and offshore operating areas.At Apache, there is a world of opportunity. With a history of using sound financial practices and an abundant inventory of near-term and future development projects, the company is admired across the industry for its ability to navigate in a rapidly changing world. Apache succeeds in recognizing opportunity and acting quickly. The growth of the company comes from the coordinated efforts of its diverse and accomplished workforce.Our VISION is to be the premier exploration and production company, contributing to global progress by helping meet the world's energy needs.Our MISSION is to grow in an innovative, safe, environmentally responsible and profitable manner for the long-term benefit of our stakeholders.Our STRATEGY is to take a differentiated approach to the exploration and production of cost-advantaged hydrocarbons through innovation, technology, optimization, continuous improvement and relentless focus on costs to deliver top-tier, long-term returns.Apache is proud to have been named a Top Workplace in Houston and is one of the world’s most admired companies by Fortune. Our global team is brought together by a shared sense of ownership, team of teams approach and the knowledge that best answers win.Apache believes in a culture that encourages everyone to bring their unique perspective and background to work every day and to know that their voice is valued and respected.Apache provides a challenging and rewarding work environment, supported by a premier total compensation package that includes competitive base salaries and benefits along with performance-driven incentives.For Additional Information About Apache, Please VisitOperating LocationsCommitment to SustainabilityApache Reports and FilingsPosition Description & DutiesThe Contracts Analyst for Apache Corporation will be a member of Apache’s Global Supply Chain organization at the company’s Houston office reporting to the Director of Contracting and Procurement. The role will be responsible for the development and fulfillment of Supply Chain Contracts, specifically Master Service Agreements. This position is a critical part of the contracting team responsible for the contracting of goods and/or services required for the business.This Role Will Be Primarily Responsible For The FollowingApplies commercial acumen, knowledge of commercial contract law, and Apache guidelines, practices, and requirements to develop appropriate terms and conditions;Uses knowledge of SAP Ariba and works with Contracts Lead to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the contracting process;Utilizes approved Apache contract templates when available and engages clause owners when required;Develops master agreements, contract service call-offs, amendments, and contract addendums;Advises and participates with Category Management and Strategic Sourcing team during commercial negotiations;Maintains appropriate contract files in accordance with document retention policy and supports required audit activity;Interfaces with the Category Management and Strategic Sourcing team to drive alignment on category and contracting strategies and requirements;Collaborates with legal, risk, and other functional/asset teams to ensure continuity and a consistent approach to contracts development and implementation across the business;Establishes strong relationships with key business leaders within Apache to facilitate information sharing, best practices, and lessons learned;Ensures that sound, fit-for-purpose contracts are developed at the highest standard and to the scheduled requirements of the business requestor;Supports the contracting team in driving towards achievement of all aspects of contract excellence in planning, solicitation, development, negotiation, execution, and administration of contracts;Ensures compliance with related policies and contract processes and standards;Participates in the development and maintenance of the Contracting Standards & Key Procedures; andAs required, supports the resolution of issues/disputes (pricing, quality, timing, claims, liens, etc.) associated with contracts.Preferred & Minimum RequirementsThe successful candidate will have the following qualifications and experience:Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management or relevant Business / Technical discipline;Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM) – Preferred;3+ years of experience providing contracts support;Working knowledge of standard commercial terms and conditions; andUpstream Oil & Gas experience with specific planning and supply chain activities related to drilling, completion, or production is preferred. Primary Performance & Leadership CompetenciesA results-oriented self-starter; able to excel with limited supervision;Possesses commercial acumen with demonstrated competency in contracting practices;Understands commercial frameworks and contract terms & conditions;Working knowledge of Contract Management processes and tools;Ability to establish and manage to effective operational and performance metrics to demonstrate delivery on objectives;Strong project management skills with ability to establish priorities and manage to planned outcomes;Strong critical thinking skills;Effective communicator with influential presentation and interpersonal skills;Ability to coordinate multiple activities, prioritize tasks, and respond quickly to stakeholders;Fosters effective teamwork and collaboration;Able to positively influence stakeholders;Excellent computer literacy with particularly high proficiency in MS Office;Experience and knowledge of Ariba SAP; andTravel Required – less than 10.Core Values & Leadership AttributesThe successful candidate will lead by example through the embodiment of, and by embracing, Apache's Core Values and Leadership Attributes:Core Values:Expect top performance & innovation;Seek relentless improvements in all facets;Invest in our greatest asset, our people;Foster a contrarian spirit;Drive to succeed with a sense of urgency;Safety is not negotiable & will not be compromised;Conduct our business with honesty & integrity;Treat our stakeholders with respect & dignity; andWe derive benefit from the earth & take our environmental responsibility seriously.Leadership Attributes:Responsible irreverence;Focus on team accomplishments over personal gain;Decisive, invested, committed;Safety is not negotiable & will not be comprised;Fire in the belly;Lead by example, be an ambassador for Apache’s values;Sees the big picture, translates into action;Sound judgement and emotional maturity;Best answers win;Working managers; andEffective communicators.Apache Statement on HiringTo provide genuine equal opportunity to all people, it is the policy of Apache Corporation and its subsidiaries to base all employment-related decisions and actions exclusively on employment-related criteria. To provide genuine equal opportunity to all people, it is the policy of Apache Corporation and its subsidiaries to provide broad dissemination of job opportunities, as consistent with the nature of the positions. To provide genuine equal opportunity to all people, it is the policy of Apache Corporation and its subsidiaries to review its employment-related policies and actions on a regular basis to ensure that their application is consistent with their intent.Equal Employment Opportunity

company: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
description: Posting InformationPosition Type Permanent Staff (EHRA NF)Department Ath Football Office-273500Working Title Asst. Dir. of Player Personnel- Football Analyst-DefenseAppointment Type EHRA Non-FacultyPosition Posting Category AthleticsSalary RangeFull Time/Part Time? Full-Time PermanentHours per Week 40Vacancy ID NF0004987Position ID 20032272Posting Open Date 06/11/2021Application DeadlineOpen Until Filled YesProposed Start Date 06/21/2021Position SummaryReporting to the Director of Player Personnel, the primary responsibilities of this position include: identify prospects for defensive assistant coaches to evaluate and assist with evaluation workflow; oversee creation of evaluation tapes for prospects and coordinate recruiting assignments and travel for defensive position coaches; management of data input into JumpForward database and XOS for recruiting and compliance purposes; conduct research, analysis and reports information on all prospects to coaches; and coordinates relevant functions that require access to information on potential student-athletes; provide assistance with recruiting activities and other football program functions, as permitted by NCAA rules and policies governing non-coaching staff members. Must demonstrate integrity, leadership, a strong commitment and ability to motivate, teach, counsel, and recruit academically qualified students. Master’s degree preferred. All degrees must be from fully accredited institutions.Qualifications And Experience1-3 years working in intercollegiate football environment required. Prefer experience in video analysis breakdown and reporting for intercollegiate football, as well as experience working in an FBS intercollegiate office. Computer and video system literacy and expertise, in particular with XOS and DVSport, Microsoft Office, JumpForward or similar database. Technical football knowledge and basic knowledge of the evaluation process and ability to identify prospect talent. Effective organizational and interpersonal communications skills.Equal Opportunity Employer The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Ath. Dir. & Football General Mgr.Department Contact Telephone or Email billyhigh@unc.eduOffice of Human Resources Contact InformationIf you experience any problems accessing the system or have questions about the application process, please contact the Office of Human Resources at (919) 843-2300 or send an email to employment@unc.eduPlease note: The Office of Human Resources will not be able to provide specific updates regarding position or application status.

title: Deputy Sports Editor
description: Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is a subscription-led and digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to empowering communities to thrive. With an unmatched reach at the national and local level, Gannett touches the lives of millions with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services.Our current portfolio of media assets includes USA TODAY, local media organizations in 46 states in the U.S., and Newsquest, a wholly owned subsidiary operating in the United Kingdom with more than 120 local news media brands. Gannett also owns the digital marketing services companies ReachLocal, Inc., UpCurve, Inc., and WordStream, Inc., which are marketed under the LOCALiQ brand, and runs the largest media-owned events business in the U.S., USA TODAY NETWORK Ventures.To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com .The Palm Beach Post is seeking a Deputy Sports Editor whowill help the staff create must-read content that separates us from the packand leads to growing our audience and increasing digital subscriptions.That means energizing the staff, breaking news consistently,coming up with regular enterprise and analysis pieces, following analytics andmaximizing the talent we have.This person will find a way to lift our coverage in everyway. That means understanding what works best digitally; while this person willhave help with the optimization distribution and promotion of stories, theyshould lead the way in how and when our content shows up online.They also will devote time to making sure our print editionremains strong, but with the understanding that early deadlines change how weplan for print. So this person will find ways to create the new sports sectionthat is a must read and does not rely on game scores.This person should not hesitate to try new things, but nothaphazardly. They should have detailed plans and set strategies and goals, thentrack results.They will be tasked to work with our vast USA Today Networknationwide, sharing information, content, ideas, to always improve.This person should have a deep knowledge of how video,audio, newsletters and social media can be used to boost our coverage.We’re not looking for someone who manages the SportsDepartment. We’re looking for a game-changer. Someone willing to blow up whatdoesn’t work and come up with new, exciting ideas.Reports to: the Post sports editorDuties: Backing up the Post sports editor, performingduties when the sports editor is tied up with other things, and covers when the sports editor is onvacation. This could include some state-wide duties, depending on the status ofthe deputy state sports editors.Other DutiesWork directly with the Post sports staff, includingbrainstorming on story ideas, discussing daily content, editing copy (usuallyfirst reads) and making sure there are photos, videos and other elements withthat content.Work closely with the high school sports reporter ondetermining and assigning live coverage. Be the point person on Friday nightsfor our high school football coverage, including editing stories, postingstories online and sending to print.Work with the high school sports reporter on Gannett’shigh school sports awards, including assisting in choosing the various teamsthroughout the school year, ensuring there are photos for thoseteams, overseeing any special sections/pages on those teams and being theliaison with the Gannett Sports Awards Event Team throughout the year and onthe awards ceremony/banquet.On those Saturdays during college football season when weare staffing a game, be the point person for communicating with those writers,editing those stories, posting those stories online and sending to print.Manage the daily sports budgets, working closely with thesports editor and planning team. Represent The Post in the daily PlanningMeeting.Oversee the sports stringers. Help find people who wantto work as Post sports correspondents, assign stories and game coverage tothose stringers, working closely with the high school sports writer, and managetheir invoices and payments.Work in unison with the sports editor in developing localenterprise stories and investigative pieces and with deputy state sports editoron state-wide enterprise/investigative pieces. Meet regularly with the Poststaff to discuss these potential stories and help the writers find elements(photos, graphics, videos, etc.) to complement their stories.Work with the DOT team to make sure all content isoptimized and help decide which content should be digital sub or metered. Alsohelp monitor Post Sports social media posts and Newsletters.#contentGan.contentGannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are a drug free, EEO employer committed to a diverse workforce. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation, or veteran status.Apply Now

title: Vice President Construction
description: A great experience starts with you! Honda Center welcomes fans, performers, and athletes from around the globe. Our team members are an integral part of the event experience through their interactions with guests. Whether you’re looking to create a great guest experience at a concert, support business growth and development, work behind-the-scenes during an Anaheim Ducks game, or anything in-between, this is your opportunity to start the next chapter of your career story and help create a one-of-a-kind fan experience at Honda Center. Once you've had a chance to explore our current open positions, apply to the ones you feel best suit you, as an applicant, you can always see your application status in your profile. Job Title:Vice President Construction ocV!BE, the premier mixed-use community and live entertainment district, is coming to Anaheim in 2024. This $3 billion, 115-acre, mixed-use community will surround its anchor, Honda Center, with new live entertainment venues, dining and retail offerings, and public amenities. From intimate clubs to a new 6,000-capacity concert venue, ocV!BE will provide a full range of entertainment, activating the district daily for the enjoyment of its guests. ocV!BE is an endeavor of the Samueli Family, the owner of the Anaheim Ducks, and the longtime manager of Honda Center. The proposed 115-acre, mixed-use ocV!BE development will feature: A sustainable community emphasizing walkability, health, and wellness, and lifestyle amenities A new 6,000-capacity concert venue 825,000 square feet of office space, including a new 325,000 square-foot office tower and 125,000 square feet of new creative office 2,800 residential units, including a commitment of 15% affordable housing units 30 acres of public open space including three unique plazas and 20 acres of park space A 5-acre, riverfront park with the ability to host seasonal outdoor concerts and events 30+ restaurant concepts, including a food hall with diverse offerings and multiple standalone restaurants Uniquely themed and intimate clubs Two hotels, consisting of 650 rooms total, thematically aligned with the energy of the district 8,700+ parking spaces among several structures, new roads, and increased capacity to enhance ingress/egress 13,000 new construction jobs and 3,300 permanent jobs upon completion As we continue to expand and diversify our portfolio with the development of ocV!BE, it becomes increasingly important to have a subject matter expert leading this exciting construction effort. The Vice President, Construction, will work directly with the Real Estate Development team and other senior management personnel on business and strategic planning and focus on improving current systems and work processes.They will direct, oversee, and manage the operations of the construction for all ocV!BE entertainment district capital projects according to the company's established policies and objectives. Responsibilities Manages and directs the overall portfolio of new construction projects within the ocV!BE entertainment district During design and pre-construction phases of projects, partners with colleagues in Design, Asset Management, Programming, Operation and Development through the design process, providing in-depth and ongoing input on constructability Understands and implements site quality control and adherence to plans and specifications to effectively deliver construction projects Negotiates with construction contractors and ensures bid documents and review contracts encompass the complete scope coverage Assists with developing project budgets and preparing project budget reports; responsible for financial control/reporting on construction projects Formulates and recommends the budgetary and operational objectives of the design and development team and monitors results according to these objectives Meets with the Executive Team to inform company executives of activities, results, and developments that could have an impact on corporate objectives and the activities of other departments Ensures the coordination with Development on the approval of architectural and engineering construction drawings with respect to budget, schedule, and constructability Oversees and directs the work of key General Contractors, sub-contractors, construction-associated consultants, and vendors to ensure conformance with contracts. Enforces contractor and subcontractor compliance with building and safety codes Produces project master schedule in coordination with the project team including asset management/real estate development, leasing, property management, operations, design, and general contractors Ensures that procurement of materials, supplies, and equipment meets project needs and purchases and schedules all long lead items Tracks hard and soft cost expenditures against project budgets and contracts and ensures all tasks are completed within budget and schedule Reviews and evaluates change orders and claims Provides leadership, direction, and advice to ensure efficient delivery of services and completion of projects Communicates priorities, provides guidance, evaluates performance, clarifies issues, identifies solutions, and communicates goals Knowledge, Skills, and Experience 15+ years of experience in real estate development/construction is required to manage a complex portfolio of commercial, office, retail, residential, or mixed-use projects Thorough knowledge of all base building systems and demonstrated understanding and ability with project controls, project management, construction documentation, and sequencing A degree in Architecture, Engineering or Construction Management is desirable Working knowledge of construction costs, alternate materials/methods, value-engineering techniques, Building/Occupancy laws, and lease requirements Ability to demonstrate skills in managing successful projects; timelines; procure and engage construction and consulting services Successful track record of collaboration with design teams and project management and property operations/leasing Ability to maintain professionalism in the face of deadlines; exhibits good listening, negotiation, and problem-solving skills; and handles confidential information with discretion and trustworthiness Strong technical and management background Strong leadership abilities; able to motivate and direct employees Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously Excellent time management, documentation, communication, organization, and personal effectiveness skills, as well as good computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, and Project) and project management tools Good negotiating skills Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive issues Outstanding internal and external customer service skills Company:ocV!BE Sports & Entertainment, LLC If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
industries: Sports, Facilities Services, and Entertainment

title: Outreach Coordinator
description: All cultures, races, disabilities, religions, sexual orientations, and gender identities are welcome at Boys & Girls Aid.SummaryUnder the direction of the Marketing & Outreach Manager, the Community Outreach Coordinator develops program-specific recruitment and marketing plans for targeted demographics for the purpose of recruiting and retaining potential foster parents. 20 hours per week will be spent on foster parent recruitment and 20 hours a week will be spent on marketing and community outreach to increase the number of new foster parent inquiries and applications.What You'll Do Asa Outreach CoordinatorPlans, advertises, conducts, and creates content for information sessions and educational presentations with individuals and families, community groups, and businesses to educate and promote our foster care programs.Identifies and meets quarterly and annual targeted recruitment goals through individual and group recruitment activities.Implements plans through multiple marketing and communications activities which may include visibility campaigns (brochures, ads/classified, web ads), networking and community meetings, presentations, community events, media outreach, and content development.Identifies, cultivates, solicits, and maintains relationships with individuals and families, community groups, educational institutions, associations, and other community entities to ensure visibility for our foster care programs; provides content and process for consistent follow up and relationship management to maintain current relationships and establish and retain new relationships.Identifies, researches, and stays current on industry information, practices, and recruitment and retention strategies.Documents all recruitment activities (contacts, follow up, visits, presentations, community events, action items, and next steps) and prospects and results in recruitment, which could include tracking in databases, running reports, and any additional tracking efforts as needed.Makes decisions and recommends prospects to foster parent certification.Implements retention strategies with current foster parent pool by sending appreciation cards and planning individual and group appreciation events.Tracks regularly current full-time and respite beds, both active and offline, with the ability to report current totals when request.What Boys & Girls Aid Can Offer YouA commitment to your professional development through enhancedtrainingon a wide range of topics including Trauma-Informed Care, attachment, and best practiceapproaches.An opportunity to promote social justice for youth who are in foster care, are involved with juvenile justice, or are experiencing homelessness.Guidance from knowledgeable, attentive supervisors who will help you succeed in yourjob.A focus on your health and well-being our benefits package includes alternative, holistic care and a comprehensive Employee Assistance Program.RequirementsBachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, Social Science, Community Development or equivalent.Demonstrated understanding of recruiting and/or outreach into the community, specifically to culturally and socio-economically diverse groups or experience in a related field where skills and experience will transfer. Prior experience in providing foster care certification or home study documents preferred.Experience with public speaking, presentations, and networking. Experience using customer relationship management software.Must possess a valid driver's license from state of residence (Oregon or Washington), personal automobile liability insurance, and pass a DMV driving record check.You must be able to wearappropriateCOVID-19 Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) required to perform the job safely.Note: This job description is representative of the major position requirements and is not intended to be all-inclusive.

title: Project Manager
description: Project ManagerJob ID 847 Date posted 06/17/2021Job DescriptionThe IT Project Manager ensures their assigned technical projects are well managed and that the project goals are delivered via the established OneIT Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Life Cycle (PMLC). This role may manage multiple high dollar, high risks projects in a matrix environment. (S)he manages the projects scope, schedule, budget and quality. This position manages a matrixed team and communicates with multiple stakeholders. (S)he documents risks and issues and works with the team to resolve or escalate. (S)he collects, measures, reports and communicates project status with the project team and IT leadership.Project Management - Oversees all aspects of project planning, management and execution (scope, schedule and budget). Works with the business to ensure the business case and ROI are documented. Works with IT to ensure the technical solution meets the business objectives. Responsible for creating a comprehensive project plan with sign-off from all workstreams. Ensures the project team creates and maintains appropriate deliverables while following the OneIT PMLC and SDLC. Leads budget creation and management with business, technology and finance. Facilitates contracts and contractual changes and coordinates preparations of proposals, plans, specifications, and financial conditions of vendor contracts where appropriate.Team Leadership -Responsible for proactive management in areas such as risks, budget/forecast, dependencies, etc. Works with the team and leadership to document and resolve people, schedule, technical and financial conflicts.Communication - Reports on project status to increase visibility and proactive monitoring. Encourages collaboration and ensures that all viewpoints are represented and explored. Communicates business and technology issues and solutions. Responsible for conducting effective meetings where the objectives are met and the project is moving forward.Project Manager experienced with implementation and adoption of Office365 (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, Yammer, OneDrive, etc.), messaging & collaboration tools/services/reporting, End-user service management including Microsoft End-Point Manager, Windows, Mac, iOS and Android. Working knowledge of Microsoft AD, Azure Active Directory, Conditional Access, Azure AD Connect, FIM, Powershell, scripting, automation tool preferred.About UsCarnival Cruise Line is the most popular cruise brand in North America and operates a fleet of ships designed to foster exceptionally safe, fun and memorable vacation experiences at an outstanding value. We live and share a positive attitude which is based on fostering an environment of inclusion, trust, a willingness to listen, openness and integrity. Doing this helps us to achieve our ultimate goal, which is to include FUN in everything we do! Speaking of fun, we are officially certified as a Great Place to Work aboard our ships as well as in our global corporate headquarters!Carnival Corporation & plc and Carnival Cruise Line is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. title: Program Manager Business Transformation Office
description: Job SummaryProvides dedicated support for transformation programs by facilitating business case and timeline development, managing progress to milestones, and refining benefits assumptions as necessary. Partners with business teams to regularly guide supporting indicators - challenging assumptions and proactively highlighting impact on customers and organization. Serves as a trusted, results-oriented, transformation subject matter expert. Responsible for programs that are cross-functional, cross-divisional, and are of significant magnitude and important to the implementation of corporate business strategies and achievement of company objectives. Program work has a significant impact on the organization. Budget responsibilities are based on program requirements.Job Responsibilities Supports, organizes, directs, manages and controls inter-related program activities for transformation programs with most significant scope, benefits, and impact across business units. Implements prioritized transformation programs, setting program management routines and bringing focus to the team on the activities preferred to deliver on planned benefits. Directs program activities to ensure high quality results within defined time and budget schedules. Collaborates with business stakeholders and executive team to develop the end to end approach and evaluation of transformation programs. Analyzes and shares program-specific insights and recommendations to achieve operational effectiveness and expected benefits capture. Assesses and measures ongoing impact and evaluates changes to key assumptions / planned impact. Ensures programs are completed according to time and budget schedules, and that goals conform to division overall standards and operations goals and project requirements. Manages prioritization of projects within the program, ensuring that each project achieves its overall benefits. Proactively works with program teams to identify cross-functional complexities and resolve program level risks and issues. Resolves high level conflicts and negotiates with stakeholders. Manages the identification of needed expertise and requirements based on engagement model and functional expertise. When preferred, directs the activities of project teams through leadership and collaboration with other Business Transformation Office team members. If needed, oversees the performance management of matrixed team. Processes and synthesizes transformation program outputs into executive-level presentations, updates, risks, mitigations, and business recommendations. When preferred, develops and mentors staff through on-boarding, open communication, training and development opportunities and performance management processes; develops and maintains employee morale and motivation; ensures the team is appropriately staffed with preferred competencies; fosters a diverse and inclusive organization. An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the Retail Pharmacy USA Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), a global leader in retail pharmacy. As America’s most loved pharmacy, health and beauty company, Walgreens purpose is to champion the health and wellbeing of every community in America. Operating more than 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving approximately 8 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with platforms bringing together physical and digital, supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in local communities nationwide.Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree and at least 4 years experience in one or more of the following functions: strategy, project management or process improvement OR High School Diploma/GED and at least 7 years of experience in one or more of the following functions: strategy, project management or process improvement.Extensive experience applying / executing project management methodologies and practices including developing a project plan, charter, scope, project management approach and management plans, including knowledge of complex project management financials.Project experience aligned to one or more of the following industries: Retail, Healthcare, Insurance, Pharmacy, CPG.Experience with Portfolio Management.Experience managing complex, cross-functional, and enterprise-wide change.Experience presenting and reporting on program plans and cost-benefit analysis to appropriate stakeholders, executives and senior management.Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community & with vendors.Experience in identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems.Strong organizational, written, and verbal communication skills.Experience with MS Office Suite.At least 2 years of experience planning, developing, and managing departmental expense and capital budgets.At least 2 years of experience of direct leadership and/or cross functional team leadership.Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).Preferred QualificationsMBA/Master’s degree.Knowledge of business practices as related to functional area (e.g., strategy, project management, lean six sigma).Experience facilitating with strategic planning initiatives.Experience with PPM tools.Experience influencing others, including senior leadership.Acquired PMP Certification or willingness to obtain certification.Experience utilizing project management software and other standard project management scheduling tools, such as MS Project.

title: Technical Analyst (remote)
description: DescriptionKCF Technologies is an exciting and rapidly growing technology company dedicated to putting innovative solutions to work in the Industrial World. SmartDiagnostics, our IIOT Technology, fuels our mission to Transform American Industry through helping our customers eliminate downtime, eradicate waste, increase safety, and elevate manufacturing jobs across the United States. To accomplish this epic technical revolution, we integrate our core values into our everyday actions and consistently challenge the status quo! Learn more at www.kcftech.com.Where You Come InWe are currently seeking a Technical Analyst to join our growing team, working specifically in Power Generation or Chemicals! As a Technical Analyst/ Engineer on the KCF Team, you'll have the opportunity to work on a collaborative team of engineers in one of the most exciting fields in technology!KCF Technical Analysts/ Engineers help our industrial customers remotely and continuously monitor their factory equipment to prevent unplanned failures and optimize operation to extend machine life. Technology and data analysis provide the backbone for delivering actionable advice to customers, so your ability to learn vibration and other types of machine health analysis is key. Our team will provide you the detailed training you need, but you need to bring the capability and desire to absorb the training and become an expert. Personal interaction is key; we focus on relationship-building and establishing trust with our customers so that they are excited to work with us to improve their plant's operation, making their jobs easier and more valuable.This engineering role has the ability to be remote from your current location in the US, and travel requirements may vary depending on your current location. Any industry or vibration analysis experience you bring to the table is a major plus and will accelerate your ability to succeed.This is starting to sound like your next challenge, right? Read on for more info!Essential FunctionsDeliver SmartDiagnostics Sentry® monitoring services including installation, setup, and ongoing vibration analysis and machine health diagnosisPerform Quality Assurance of SmartDiagnostics® software and hardware productsPerform customer training programs on SmartDiagnostics® software and hardwareAnswer questions and solve customer problemsAdditional duties as assignedQualificationsBachelor's degree in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, physical science, or similar2-3 years experience working in the Metals Industry strongly preferredVibration Analysis experience strongly preferredMechanical aptitude, engineering mindset, hands-on experience, and enjoyment of learning how things workSuperior communication skills; written, face-to-face, and over the phoneAble, willing, and excited to travel and maneuver through large industrial plantsPerks & BenefitsAt KCF, we are committed to providing best-in-class benefits, engaging development opportunities, and powerful perks that are focused on bringing out the best in you:100% Company paid Medical InsuranceCompany provided Vision & Dental planHybrid remote work model- work from home, work from anywhereCompetitive compensation & quarterly bonus opportunitiesFour weeks PTO; paid Holidays401(k) with KCF matchWellness Initiatives, including generous fitness reimbursementsMonthly cell-phone stipendLearning culture committed to Growth and Development- courses and training programs available to all employeesAt KCF, we are an equal opportunity employer. The only things we require for employment, compensation, advancement and benefits are performance and a good team attitude. No one will be denied opportunities or benefits, and no employment decisions will be made, on the basis of race, religion/creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, disability that does not prohibit performance of essential job functions, protected veteran status, medical condition, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, possession of a general education development certificate (GED) as compared to a high school diploma, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal or state laws. KCF complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which KCF has facilities.#PM19 Requirements:PI140840191

description: Position Summary: MLB Network seeks a Paralegal with knowledge, experience, and understanding of legal and business affairs issues. The paralegal is expected to complete assigned projects independently, subject to guidance, supervision and review as needed.ResponsibilitiesProvides legal support to the Business and Legal Affairs team.Contract administration, including organizing and maintaining agreement files (electronic and physical), finalize agreements for signature and distribution, draft and send correspondence, circulate agreements internally, etc. Create and maintain agreement tracking charts (e.g., talent, intellectual property, 3rd party productions, programming rights, 3rd party content clearances, etc.), notify various departments when agreements are up for renewal, track renewal/termination notice letter deadlines, and input contract information into contract management system.Draft initial smaller form-based agreements for review (e.g., work for hire releases for MLBN/NHLN/MLBN Productions content, hotel agreements, crewer agreements, NDAs, voiceover agreements, etc.). Ability to lift 20 pounds.Possess visual acuity sufficient to perform required tasks.Possess manual dexterity sufficient to perform required tasks.Possess a level of hearing sufficient for effective interaction with stakeholders by various mean, including in-person, via phone, etc.Education: Bachelor’s degree is required.

repetitive hand and arm motion.Occasionally lift and carry up to 40 pounds.Normal dexterity, frequent holding and grasping.Regular attendance is an essential function.Knowledge OfPrinciples, methods, and techniques of land use planning and zoning administration.Current trends in land use planning and community design; planning/zoning ordinances and regulations.Research and statistical methods; principles, practices and techniques of drafting.Land use relationships, socio-economic factors, site planning and environmental impact assessment.Laws, ordinances, and regulations governing planning in California and Merced County.The California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA), and environmental impact assessments.Ability ToAnalyze socio-economic and environmental data as well as develop alternative solutions to problems.Communicate clearly, concisely and effectively in writing and orally and through graphic illustrations.Establish and maintain effective working relationship with staff, public and other departments.Analyze project proposals and prepare staff reports for decision-making bodies.Interpret planning laws and apply them to development proposals.Read and interpret maps, charts and illustrations used in planning activities.Assess citizen goals and formulate plans, objectives and policies to respond to these needs.Prepare planning ordinances needed to implement specific plans.Provide lead direction and guidance to staff and organize and conduct major research studies. HOLIDAYS & LEAVESVACATION10 days the first 5 years of continuous employment (limited to a maximum of 160 hours), 15 days in the second 5 years of continuous employment (limited to a maximum of 240 hours), and 20 days after 10 years of continuous employment (limited to a maximum of 320 hours). SICK LEAVE0462 hours sick leave for each paid regularly scheduled work hour. 12 days (96 hours per year) with unlimited accumulation. Optional annual buy back of a portion of accumulated sick leave hours upon meeting certain criteria. HOLIDAYSTwelve paid holidays annually plus one optional holiday. BEREAVEMENT LEAVEThree (3) regularly scheduled work days or five (5) days if distance traveled over 500 miles one-way. LIFE INSURANCE$10,000 County-paid coverage (Accidental Death and Dismemberment included). Voluntary Term Life and Universal Life Insurance available - premium paid by employee. RETIREMENTDeferred CompensationThe County offers a 457 Deferred Compensation Plan. Employees choose their investment funds and can make pretax contributions to the plan up to the maximum allowable. title: Employment Specialist.
description: Department InformationThe Office of Human Resources & Institutional Equity (HRIE) nurtures dynamic work and learning environments through a commitment to respectful, diverse, and inclusive practices. The department strives to build a culture of excellence by applying expertise in recruiting, retaining, developing, and supporting each member of the Pack community. HRIE promotes respectful, rewarding, diverse, and inclusive work and learning environments.Description of JobThe Employment Specialist is responsible for the employment cycle process for full- and part-time support of Administrative Professional, Classified, and Faculty (as needed) positions, including posting vacancy announcements using the applicant tracking system (NEOGov), approval of search committees, confirming applicants minimum qualification requirements, approving interview pools and reference questions, processing reference checks, and extending job offers. The Employment Specialist also assists in preparing staffing plans and compensation studies, monitors open positions, conducts search and screen related training sessions, and serves as system administrator for the applicant tracking system and onboarding oversight to ensure necessary paperwork is completed.Primary DutiesRecruitment And Selection ProcessesResponsible for the entirety of the recruitment and selection cycle for full- and part-time Classified and non-Classified (e.g. faculty and professional staff) positions including:Manages the full hiring process and candidate communications through NEOGov.Determines appropriate recruitment strategies. Conducts job analyses. Develops and publishes job announcements. Reviews applications for minimum qualifications. Recommends and reviews candidate rating formats and offers direction on rating strategies. Completes referral processes (candidate movement) in NEOGov. Reviews interview and reference questions and guides individuals on appropriate interview questions and process. Responds to hiring manager, search and screen committee, and candidate inquiries.Responds to applicant appeals (Classified only).Search and screen policies and procedures: Develops and maintains search and screen manual.Reviews and communicates proper policy and procedure for selection.Informs and advises applicants, employees, supervisors, and managers in the areas of State Personnel Rules and Procedures, Equal Pay Act, and CSU Pueblo policies and procedures. Provides guidance and direction regarding dispute resolution by reviewing and interpreting appropriate rules and laws.Onboarding:Processes background checks Ensures required new hire paperwork is completed in a timely manner, in compliance with federal, state and University requirements. Coordinates with HR staff to preserve new hire paperwork, completes checklists and conducts regular audits to ensure all documents are present in each new employee’s file.Training: Hosts monthly search and screen related training. Develops and delivers recruiting-related training materials.ATS (NeoGov) Management :Builds out and manages NeoGov to deliver electronic versions of approvals and notifications to relevant university leadership and employees.ReportingWeekly reporting on status of in-process, open and closed positionsWeekly reporting to President on newly hired employees Monthly reporting for HRIE newsletterImmigration:Coordinates with all parties for visa-sponsored employees including attorneys, supervisors, employees, Executive Director and HR.Ensures all required signatures are obtained and paperwork completed and submitted to immigration attorneys.Ensure files are maintained with all immigration related documentation.Occasional and Irregularly performed duties:Other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal RightsMinimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Business, Human Resources, Public Administration, or related field.Demonstrated ability to work effectively and independently with all levels within an organization.Demonstrated organizational and communication (both oral and written) skills.Demonstrated ability to maintain confidential information.Ability to facilitate and lead educational sessions for varying audience types and sizes.Demonstrated knowledge of relevant state and federal employment laws and governmental compliance requirements related to human resources management and employment functions including Colorado’s Equal Pay Act.Demonstrated ability to analyze information, prepare reports, and make appropriate recommendations and decisions.Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Demonstrated ability to work professionally with others and resolve interpersonal conflict.3+ years of related professional experience.2+ years of experience working with and maximizing applicant tracking system software.Preferred QualificationsMaster’s degree or higher in Human Resources or related field.PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP.Demonstrated commitment to equity and inclusion.Demonstrated commitment to the mission and values of our regional comprehensive university.NEOGov applicant tracking system experience.Public sector experience, particularly within the state of Colorado.Higher education experience.

title: Drawing, Painting and Print Assistant
description: General PurposeThis position will work closely with the BCA Education Director and education staff to provide critical assistance to help our Drawing, Painting and Print studios run smoothly and efficiently.This position requires 8-10 onsite hours per week when studio access is running (approximately 34 weeks per year).Essential Job Functions Maintaining the overall health and safety of the Drawing, Painting and Print Studios including: maintaining supplies and equipment and keeping Safety Data Sheets updated. Cleaning, organizing, ordering supplies, and fixing equipment when necessary. Hosting two 4 hour shifts of studio access per week for seasonal members and students. Coordinating, training and managing 4-6 volunteer studio assistants to provide a robust weekly schedule of studio access. Working collaboratively with education staff to support all classes and camp programs. Processing member payments and other administrative tasks as required. Coordinating and installing studio member and student artwork on walls for special events including Art Hop. Qualifications/Basic Job Requirements Must be 18 years or older. High school diploma or equivalent required. Previous experience in Drawing, Painting and Printmaking required. Bachelor’s degree in Drawing, Painting and Printmaking or related field preferred. Additional experience may be substituted for a degree requirement on a two-for-one per year basis. 1-2 years of experience in studio arts coordination/management or related field preferred. Must have a desire to work in a community arts setting with wide variety of students, community members and volunteers. Must be available to work all hours onsite (notably for two 4 hour shifts per week when studio access is running). Must demonstrate a cooperative team-player attitude and a high level of enthusiasm, punctuality, and dependability. Strong organizational skills and experience working with computer applications (Microsoft office programs including Excel) required. Must be able to work independently under general supervision in a fast-paced environment and be able to adapt to a changing schedule. Must demonstrate ability to professionally represent the City of Burlington and the City Arts Department in all dealings with community members, students, artists, local officials, and City Arts Board members. Ability to actively support City diversity, equity, inclusion and cultural competency efforts within stated job responsibilities and work effectively across diverse cultures and constituencies. Regular attendance is necessary and is essential to meeting the expectations of the job functions. Ability to understand and comply with City standards, safety rules and personnel policies. Must pass a criminal background check. Must be able to lift 50 lbs.
